newsitem.title: USA: Silicon Valley to restate balance sheet.
newsitem.headline: Silicon Valley to restate balance sheet.

text.p: Silicon Valley Research Inc said it will restate its balance sheet as of September 30, 1996, resulting in a reduction of accounts receivable, long term receivables and deferred revenue totalling $2.2 million.

The reversal is due to the discovery of backdated documents. Silicon Valley has not recorded any revenues relating to this license agreement due to its extended payment terms, and accordingly will not restate its quarterly results of operations as a result of this finding.
An audit committee is investigating the company's compliance with revenue recognition policies.

The company also announced that Glenn Abood has resigned as president and as a director of the company and that Robert Anderson, chairman of the board and chief executive officer, has replaced Cheryl Billings as chief financial officer.
The company anticipates that announcement of its third quarter results will be delayed.
